definition: to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory

sentences.english: Last season was a humiliating homecoming.
sentences.chinese: 上賽季榮歸故里是演砸了。

sentences.english: Spain's triumphant national football team has returned home from South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙國家足球隊從南非得勝榮歸。

sentences.english: Gonzalez is back home after being deployed to Iraq three times.
sentences.chinese: Gonzalez被派往伊拉克三次後榮歸故里。

sentences.english: It was the kind of homecoming that Tyrion wished for as well.
sentences.chinese: 那也是提利昂希望的那種榮歸故里。

definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
Laiyang county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to go for a trip in spring
Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
Jianchuan county in Dali Bai autonomous prefecture 大理白族自治州[Da4 li3 Bai2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Yunnan
